Mallorga Yuliana

Full Stack Developer

San Miguel de Tucumán, Argentina
yulianamallorga@gmail.com • https://www.linkedin.com/in/yuliana-mallorga/

About

Full Stack Web Developer with 3 years of experience in building modern, and efficient web applications. Specialized in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with expertise in frameworks like React, Vite, Bootstrap, Tailwind, and Astro, as well as backend technologies such as Node.js and Express.js. Additionally, experienced in databases like PostgreSQL.

Passionate about developing high-quality software, applying best practices such as Clean Code. Skilled in responsive web design, ensuring adaptable and optimized interfaces across different devices. Strong team player with experience in project management, having served as a Scrum Master in two projects.

Committed to continuous learning and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies to develop innovative, and high-performance solutions.

Languages:
Spanish (Native) /
English (Intermediate) /

    Project demo

In it, tools such as React Router Dom are used to manage the routes that allow us to navigate between the different pages and JSON Server to simulate an external API.

  • Twitter Follow Card

    Project demo

    The Twitter Follow Card Component project focuses on developing a custom component for web applications using React. This component will allow developers to easily integrate Twitter follow cards into their sites with customization options. Vite is used as the development environment, and ESLint rules are applied to maintain code quality.

    • React
    • React DOM
    • Custom Component
    • Vite
    • Social Media Integration

    • React Hooks

  • Tic-Tac-Toe Game

    Project demo

    The 'Tic-Tac-Toe Game' is a project that creates an online version of the classic 'Tic-Tac-Toe' game. It uses React and React DOM to develop the user interface, Vite as the development environment, and ESLint rules to ensure clean code. Two players compete in real-time, and when one wins, it appears on the screen, ending the game.

    • React
    • React DOM
    • React Hooks
    • Vite
    • Eslint
    • Multiplayer Game

  • Mouse follower

    Project demo

    The 'Mouse follower' is a React project that follows the mouse pointer with an animation. It uses the useState and useEffect hooks to enable and disable mouse tracking.

    • React
    • Vite
    • React DOM
    • Eslint
    • React Hooks
    • CSS

  • React technical test

    Project demo

    The project consists of a web page as part of a technical test for React beginners and learners. It consumes two APIs and follows these instructions: First, a random fact about cats is recorded from the first API. Second, the first three words of the fact are extracted. Third, an image of a cat is displayed with the first three words of the previous fact.

    • React
    • React DOM
    • Vite
    • Data interchange
    • Text formats
    • APIs
    • Web applications
    • Eslint
    • Custom Hooks

  • Astro demo

    Project demo

    The 'Astro Demo' project renders SpaceX launches, using Tailwind CSS to style the site and TypeScript to handle logic and code typing, ensuring better scalability and maintainability. Additionally, it integrates with an API to fetch real-time launch information.

    • Astro
    • TypeScript

  • Pending Task React Ts

    Project demo

    The 'Pending Task React' TS Project is an application that allows users to add and delete tasks entered through an input field. It is built with React and TypeScript, ensuring a more structured and maintainable codebase.

  • Facial Recognition Project (Frontend)

    Project demo

    The Facial Recognition Project is an application designed to detect faces in images provided by the user via a link. To access the application, the user must register or log in and then enter the image link into an input field.

    • React
    • Vite
    • Tachyons
    • UI/UX
    • REST API
    • Clarifai
    • Eslint

  • facial-recognition-API-Back-end (Backend)

    The 'facial-recognition-API-Back-end' project is an application built with Node.js and Express.js to manage the backend of the facial recognition system. It handles user registration and login, as well as tracking the number of processed images. Additionally, it uses PostgreSQL as a database to store user information and interactions. The API has been tested and documented with Postman to ensure proper functionality.

    • Node.js
    • Express.js
    • database
    • Postman
    • PostgreSQL
    • dotenv
